bibl.note: This is a sworn statement dated June 30, 1797. It is given by John Johnston to James White, and written out by White who is the Justice of the Peace for Knox County. Johnston swears that he was shot at by some Natives while hunting.

div.p: personaly personally appeared John Johnston before me James White a Justice of the peace for Knox affxd affixed and made oath that on Wensday Wednesday the 28th of June as I was in the Woods tracking a dear deer I had shot, I Was fired at by Indians I think fore four in Number and Received a slight Wound in my side and was pursued some distance by them after the guns fired
Sworn to and Inscribed this 30th of June 1797
